text: uh I'm John Brown and I just spoke and I
gave a talk called make art not apps and
the thing that I'm trying to do is go
around to a bunch of conferences and
talk to developers and try and convince
them that art can be all around them and
they already understand how to use
functions they understand logic and if
they can sort of take their ideas and
take them out of Just The Logical path
the functional path and make things that
are very expressive they don't need to
do anything they can be totally useless
but they can apply colors to their to
their uh to their data and they can make
things that move and they're visual they
can share it's it's an amazing
experience to actually write code and
then have it be output to you in some
sort of visual format it's it's how I
got into coding the very first class I
ever took for uh for development was the
first assignment was make a red ball
move across the screen and I feel like a
lot of us had that had that experience
and then somewhere along the way that
joy and that amazingness of like seeing
your code move something on screen sort
of gets lost as you do more work you
work on a back end you're staring at
code all day so being able to decouple
the idea of I need to make something
that works and that's functional and
it's highly effective and then pushing
it over onto the other side and saying
let's just make something for the fun of
it sit on a couch with a friend and just
make something that's interesting for an
hour that is that to me is what all
developers should do once every month or
so to get their brain out of the space
uh of making these things that need to
be super efficient and just playing so I
basically go around and I talk to people
all the time and say take some time just
to just to play just to mess with code
and make something it's
fun
